title: Massachusetts House of Representatives' 8th Suffolk district
text:
Massachusetts House of Representatives' 8th Suffolk district in the United States is one of 160 <a href="legislative%20districts">legislative districts</a> included in the <a href="Massachusetts%20House%20of%20Representatives">lower house</a> of the <a href="Massachusetts%20General%20Court">Massachusetts General Court</a>. It covers part of <a href="Cambridge%2C%20Massachusetts">Cambridge</a> in <a href="Middlesex%20County%2C%20Massachusetts">Middlesex County</a> and part of <a href="Boston%2C%20Massachusetts">Boston</a> in <a href="Suffolk%20County%2C%20Massachusetts">Suffolk County</a>. <a href="Massachusetts%20Democratic%20Party">Democrat</a> <a href="Jay%20Livingstone">Jay Livingstone</a> of <a href="Back%20Bay%2C%20Boston">Back Bay</a> has represented the district since 2013.
The current district geographic boundary overlaps with those of the Massachusetts Senate's <a href="Massachusetts%20Senate%27s%20Middlesex%20and%20Suffolk%20district">Middlesex and Suffolk</a> district, <a href="Massachusetts%20Senate%27s%201st%20Suffolk%20and%20Middlesex%20district">1st Suffolk and Middlesex</a> district, and <a href="Massachusetts%20Senate%27s%202nd%20Suffolk%20and%20Middlesex%20district">2nd Suffolk and Middlesex</a> district.
